component

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • component.Component
      • component.Tile
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Tile.Crystal, Tile.DirtTile, Tile.GrassTile, Tile.LogTile, Tile.ScaffoldTile, Tile.StoneTile

    public abstract class Tile
extends Component
    A class representing a Tile drawn on the screen. A Tile can be broken and placed by the mouse, can collapse due to the load of supporting other Tiles, and can hold Tiles which are "stuck" to it on the left and right up to a certain distance.
    Author:
    Spencer Yoder

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description

      A class for logs.
      static class  Tile.ScaffoldTile
      As of now, the only Tile that can collapse under the weight of other tiles
      static class  Tile.StoneTile
      A class for stone.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(java.awt.image.BufferedImage texture,
            java.awt.image.BufferedImage lockedTexture,
            boolean canBreak,
            double breakTime,
            boolean canFall,
            int strength,
            int stickiness)
        Constructs a new Tile with the given states
        Parameters:
        texture - the texture for the display of this tile (Must be 50x50 pixels)
        canBreak - Whether or not this tile can be broken by the user
        breakTime - How long it takes this tile to be broken by the use (in seconds)
        canFall - Whether or not this tile is affected by gravity
        strength - How many tiles can be on top of this one before it breaks (-1 if indestructable)
        stickiness - How many tiles to either side this one can prevent from falling

                        int idx)
        Sets a neighbor of this tile using RIGHT, LEFT, TOP, or BOTTOM
        Parameters:
        neighbor - the Tile this will be neighboring
        idx - the index of the neighbors array the new neighbor will occupy

      • willFall

        public boolean willFall()
        Returns:
        true if this Tile should fall given its state and the state of its neighbors

      • checkSide

        private boolean checkSide(int direction,
                          int stickFactor)
        Checks the side of this Tile to see if it has enough Tiles to its one side keeping it from falling
        Parameters:
        direction - RIGHT or LEFT,
        stickFactor - How many tiles before this one will fall
        Returns:
        true if this Tile is secure

      • willCollapse

        public boolean willCollapse()
        Returns:
        true if this Tile will collapse given the number of Tiles it is supporting
